intro: Aquilegia sibirica var. flabellata, commonly known as the Siberian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features striking, spurred flowers in shades of red, pink, and white, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has compound, pinnate leaves that are finely divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its botanical characteristics make it a valued addition to both wildflower gardens and horticultural collections.
